list_definition.definition: the owner of a plantation for growing tea, rubber etc

list_ex_of_english: After emancipation such offspring were economically valueless to planters, and threatened white dominance.
Cotton was never again grown as profitably for the planters as in the period before emancipation.
In some other cases, planters, seriously short of workers, took the initiative.
A timber deck and planters provide a restful atmosphere, and the whole is enclosed in rendered walls with punched openings to frame views [30].
There is no evidence of the type of arrangements established between independent planters and mills during the years of primitive sugar production.
Even worse for the planters, journalists took the issue outside the court-room.
The type of cane growth, whether the cane is erect or lodged is an important trait for planters.
In the early stages, training was in the hands of the planters and miners themselves and officers seconded from the civil government.
